thread.title: Tanzania: Wildlife activists praise arrest of Chinese woman
thread.title_full: Tanzania: Wildlife activists praise arrest of Chinese woman | News24

author: news24.com
title: Tanzania: Wildlife activists praise arrest of Chinese woman
text:
Dar es Salaam - Wildlife activists are applauding the arrest by Tanzanian authorities of a Chinese woman for alleged ivory smuggling.
According to the Tanzanian government, the country's elephant population has plummeted from an estimated 109 051 in 2009 to 43 330 in 2014.
Yang Feng Clan, 66, was charged Wednesday in Dar es Salaam alongside two Tanzanian with smuggling nearly 1.9 tons of ivory between January 1 2000 and May 22 2014. Their case was adjourned to Monday. Escorted by policewomen from the court Wednesday, Clan raised her hands over her face as a photographer took her photo.
In Beijing, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Hua Chunying, when asked about the case at a routine ministry briefing on Friday, said she did not know about it but asserted that China is committed to protecting endangered wildlife.
